column4: did you add the old 2.4 ppa? and did you check if it still provides the driver even?

yeah.. I added the ppa  I also update the package database  don't know, what you mean with "and did you check if it still provides the driver even"  though...  do they remove the backport drivers sometimes?
also when you go to the page https://edge.launchpad.net/~ubuntu-x-swat/+archive/x-retro it does not listed the intel-2.4 package for karmic
yupp I just realized that, too...
well.. what do I do then :)?
use the intel driver in karmic?
yeah.. I want the old version, sincne i need the performance of 8.10 but don#t want to deinstall my karmic for this...
any idea how I can do this :)?
by the wiki that never worked, it lets you use the intrepid driver in hardy
yeah but I would rather like to use the hardy driver in karmic :)  that's my actual goal....
i see, but its not packaged for karmic, at least not in that ppa
do you think it would be a good idea to install this package:  https://edge.launchpad.net/~ubuntu-x-swat/+archive/x-retro/+sourcepub/644745/+listing-archive-extra  manually?
yes , use the provided intel driver or try building your own version of the 2.4 driver(or find someone that packaged it for karmic, but i doubt it tbh)
i dont know, probably not since drivers are particularly finniky, if you need 2.4 (why?) consider downgrading to jaunty?
I need to run a 3d-program which runs reallyreally slow with the new driver...  last working version was in ubuntu 8.04
I am gonna try that package now.. maybe it works :)  i think I can not damage anything with this, can I?
yupp i just installed the package..  and as I am writing in this channel it looks like it works :)
